definition: to know sth like the back of one's hand (idiom)/to know (a person, a place etc) inside out
variant of 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
unofficial variant of 瞭[liao4]
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
(of eyes) bright/clear-sighted/to understand clearly
as/as if/such as
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield

sentences.english: I knew the inner workings of hospitals better than I understood the goings on in my own home.
sentences.chinese: 我对医院的内部运作比我对自己家的状况更了如指掌。

sentences.english: I'm very familiar with all the well-known characters from Jin Yong's novels.
sentences.chinese: 金庸小说中著名的角色我全了如指掌。

sentences.english: I know every inch of Toad Hall, inside and out.
sentences.chinese: 蟾宫的里里外外，每一寸地方，我都了如指掌。

sentences.english: The technical co-founder of SNS understands cloud computing from inside out.
sentences.chinese: SNS的技术创始人对云计算可谓了如指掌。

sentences.english: Friends know well each other's strength and weaknesses.
sentences.chinese: 朋友对互相间的优缺点了如指掌。

sentences.english: But don't act as if you know everything about the place.
sentences.chinese: 但是不要表现出你对这个公司的一切都了如指掌。

sentences.english: Are the secrets of nature all mastered?
sentences.chinese: 难道大自然的奥秘都已了如指掌？

sentences.english: Maybe people aren't well informed about the Russia-China strategic ties.
sentences.chinese: 也许人们对中俄战略关系并不了如指掌。

sentences.english: She has this university at her fingertips.
sentences.chinese: 她对这所大学了如指掌。

sentences.english: He knows the terrain of this locality like the back of his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他对这一带的地形了如指掌。

sentences.english: Robert knows his business very well and has all the facts at his fingertips.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特精通业务，并对所有情况了如指掌。

sentences.english: He was just nine years old but Tim knew a thing or two about building things.
sentences.chinese: 他才九岁，但是，对做东西，提姆是了如指掌。

sentences.english: “He seems to know the area pretty well.”“Oh.
sentences.chinese: 他看来对那个地区了如指掌。

sentences.english: Can you know everything going on in your field or industry?
sentences.chinese: 你对你的行业里的任何事情都了如指掌吗？

sentences.english: Because live relatively close, and she well aware of my life.
sentences.chinese: 因为住得比较近，她对我的生活了如指掌。

definition: see 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
see 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
to be well aware of sth/to understand clearly
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
slight knowledge of sth/to know very little about a subject/a smattering
lit. as if enumerating one's family valuables (idiom)/fig. to be very familiar with a matter
to be very clear about sth (idiom)
to know what's going on
to suss out/to figure out/to ascertain
clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
to know/to understand
to clearly understand
to be well aware
to know well/to be fully aware of
lit. doesn't (even) enter a single aperture (of one's head)/I don't understand a word (idiom)/it's all Greek to me
inside information/the ins and outs of the matter/how things stand/what's up
trend/tendency
